info.value:
My mother used to say things just to make me mad. Like most teenagers, I thought I knew everything. And what I didn’t know, I didn’t want to be told. For example, if I said I was going to a movie, my mother would roll her eyes. On my way out, she’d shout, “You need to slow yourself down before something bad happens!” I thought she just wanted me to stay home.

Many years later I had three teenagers of my own. They thought they knew everything. And I would say the same things to them like my mom. That was when I first saw it. My mother wasn’t trying to make me stay at home. She was trying to help me.
